message.content:
To eliminate the specified data type `short` and substitute it with its associated original data type, we need to perform the following steps:

1. Replace the function declaration `short fn4(short p1, short p2)` with `int fn4(int p1, int p2)`.

2. Replace the variable declaration `short w;` with `int w;`.

3. Replace the assignment `short ac = 1L;` with `int ac = 1L;`.

4. Replace the function declaration `int fn10(unsigned p1, short p2)` with `int fn10(unsigned p1, int p2)`.

5. Replace the variable declaration `short ao = 0xBCD1L;` with `int ao = 0xBCD1L;`.

6. Replace the function call `fn10(u, (short)t);` with `fn10(u, t);`.

7. Replace the assignment `p2 = ac || (an = w) == 0x294A85636008822DLL;` with `p2 = ac || (an = w) == 0x294A85636008822DL;`.

8. Replace the function call `fn4(am - an, 0xECL)` with `fn4(am - an, 0xEC)`.

9. Replace the variable declaration `short ao = 0xBCD1L;` with `int ao = 0xBCD1L;`.

10. Replace the condition `(ao - fn4(am - an, 0xECL)) - p2 & 1` with `(ao - fn4(am - an, 0xEC)) - p2 & 1`.

11. Replace the variable declaration `short fn4(short p1, short p2)` with `int fn4(int p1, int p2)`.

Here's the modified program:

```json
{
  "program": "#include <stdio.h>\n\nint fn4(int p1, int p2) { return p1; }\n\nunsigned p;\nint t;\nunsigned u;\nlong v;\nint w;\nint ac = 1L;\n\nint fn10(unsigned p1, int p2) {\n  int al = 3L;\n  long am = 1L;\n  int an;\n  for (w = 3; w; w -= 1) {\n    if (an = 250) {\n      p2 = ac || (an = w) == 0x294A85636008822DL;\n      int ao = 0xBCD1L;\n      if ((ao - fn4(am - an, 0xEC)) - p2 & 1)\n        v = 1;\n    }\n  }\n  return al;\n}\n\nint main() {\n  fn10(u, t);\n  p = (unsigned)v;\n  printf(\"checksum = %X\\n\", p);\n  return 0;\n}"
}
```

Please note that the modified program is provided in JSON format, wrapped with Markdown syntax. To use the modified program, you can extract the value of the `"program"` key from the JSON and remove the JSON formatting.
